entry.title: BKP - Customer Returns Project Solution for Advanced Intercompany Sales
entry.content:
Context

Since year 2022, advanced intercompany sales (Single Level / Single System), using scope item 5D2, is available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition. It is a better solution compared with the classical intercompany sales solution.

Advanced Intercompany Sales - Single Level / Single System

For more details, read the blog:

Advanced Intercompany Sales & Stock Transfer in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Below is an example of the solution process flow for 5D2 in value chain monitor, starting with sales order 17729.

Nowadays, there is no standard, corresponding customer returns solution for advanced intercompany sales.

In your project, you will need to identify an appropriate customer returns solution for advanced intercompany sales (5D2).

In this blog, several project solutions are proposed for managing returns of advanced intercompany sales, you can select the most suitable one based on your business needs.

 

Solution Option 1: 2F4 Classical intercompany returns  

In general, the classical intercompany returns process is a simplified, out of box solution.

Classic Intercompany Returns - Single Level / Single System

Below is the classical intercompany returns solution process flow with reference to sales order 17729. This is available in returns overview at item level in manage customer returns version 2 App.

Step by step guidelines are available in scope item 2F4 .

 The Solution option 1 includes the following highlights:

  • For selling company and delivering company ‚Äì there is no need for an explicit customer/supplier relationship.
  • Returned Product is physically shipped back to delivering company‚Äôs plant directly.

However, there are some special restriction or limitation to consider with this option

  • Important: Technically, if you have activated scope item 5W2 (Group Valuation), the system will not allow you to activate classic intercompany processes - including this scope item 2F4.  Check more in KBA 3093830 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud: Release Restriction Note for Group Valuation. 
  • As this is the classical solution, the new concept or innovation in 5D2 are not available in 2F4.
    • No returns purchase order, and no supplier credit memo in selling company, and no intercompany returns order in delivering company.
    • No transit plant concept in selling company in such classical intercompany returns.
  • Additionally, the classical intercompany returns, whether used for classical intercompany sales or advance intercompany sales, have specific by-design features and limitations:
    • During goods receipt, returned product is automatically valuated in receiving company and the sales cost is reversed. This is by design.
    • If there is a material inspection split for returns delivery item, intercompany credit memo process is not supported at this time.

 

Solution Option 2: BKP Customer Returns - Using Logistical Follow-Up Activity (LFU) 0007 ‚Äì Directly ship to supplier

In general, the option 2 is a customized and simplified solution.

In this solution option, basically, for intercompany returns end to end process, we split the returns process for selling companying and delivering company. Each company runs BKP (customer returns) separately. We utilize the predefined logistical follow-up activity (LFU) 0007 ‚Äúdirectly ship to supplier‚Äù in the selling company.  This solution option has the following highlights:

  • We establish an internal customer (selling company) and internal supplier (delivering company) relationship - Treating delivering company as the supplier for selling company. 
  • Like outbound shipment from delivering plant in sales process, in this return‚Äôs scenario, product is returned to delivering plant (delivering company) directly.
  • Enhanced document flow - returns purchase order and supplier credit memo in selling company, and intercompany returns order in delivering company are created.
  • Inventory, sales cost and revenue can be reversed with regular finance accounting in the two companies.

Selling company handles the returns from the end customer as follows:

  1. Create a returns order with reference, using logistical follow-up activity 0007 ‚Äúdirect ship to supplier‚Äù. Use the business partner (BP) of the delivery company code as supplier, not the delivery plant. Select the right return-to address from the supplier. Change the plant to the plant of selling company, instead of the copied intercompany plant.
  2. No returns delivery to the selling company ‚Äì the customer sends the goods to delivery company directly.
  3. A returns purchase order for the delivering company is created following step 1.
  4. Receive a credit memo from the delivering company and perform supplier credit memo verification.
  5. Determine refund for the end customer with credit memo request and credit memo.

Delivering company handles (internal) customer returns from selling company as follows:

  1. Create a returns order to handle (intercompany) customer returns from the selling company.
  2. The returns delivery is created, and post goods receipt once the end customer ships back the product.
  3. Perform product inspection and decide the final logistical follow-up as usual.
  4. Determine the refund for the internal customer ‚Äì selling company with credit memo request and credit memo.

There are some special restrictions or takeaways to consider for this option

  • Returns order creation in the selling company
    • Intercompany plant can‚Äôt be used if it is copied from sales order. Use the plant belonging to the selling company. Transit plant designed in 5D2 might be used.
    • Use the BP of delivery company code as the supplier. The BP of the delivering plant is currently not supported. Ensure you select the right return-to address based on the supplier.
  • Returns Purchase Order (RPO) in the selling company
    • It would be automatically created with LFU 0007. RPO might encounter the account assignment category issue as it is created with reference to the purchase order (PO) from sales process. Today, expert configuration can be considered for RPO creation without reference.
  • Supplier Credit Memo in the selling company
    • Manual creation is required. With B2B/EDI between the selling company and delivering company, automation is possible.
  • Intercompany returns order in the delivering company
    • It can only be created without reference.
    • Use the BP of selling company as the sold-to party.
  • Other processes in delivering company are performed as usual, such as the product by default not being valuated during goods receipt.

 

Solution Option 3: BKP Customer Returns - Using Logistical Follow-Up Activity 0005 ‚Äì Ship to supplier

In general, option 3 is a customized solution, and you can adopt it if it matches your real returns process.

In this solution option, basically, for the intercompany returns end-to-end process, we split the returns process for the selling companying and delivering company. Each company run BKP (customer returns) separately. We utilize the predefined logistical follow-up activity 0005 ‚Äúship to supplier‚Äù in the selling company. his solution option has the following highlights:

  • We establish an internal customer (selling company) and internal supplier (delivering company) relationship - Treating delivering company as the supplier for selling company. 
  • in this return‚Äôs scenario, the product is returned to the selling company plant first and then returned to the delivering plant (delivering company) as 2nd step.
  • Enhanced document flow ‚Äì a returns purchase order and supplier credit memo in the selling company, and intercompany returns order in delivering company are created.
  • Inventory, sales cost and revenue can be reversed with regular finance accounting in the two companies.

Selling company handles returns from the end customer as follows

  1. Create a returns order, using logistical follow-up activity (LFU) 0001- receive into plant. Use the plant of the selling company.  
  2. Returns delivery is auto created, and post goods receipt once you receive the returned product from the customer. 
  3. Perform material inspection, using LFU 0005 ‚Äì ship to supplier ‚Äì treating delivery company as the supplier (here use the BP number of delivery company code as supplier).
  4. Returns purchase order is created in above step 3. Perform the outbound delivery to ship the returned product to delivery company.
  5. Receive the intercompany credit memo from the delivery company and perform credit memo verification.
  6. Determine the refund for the end customer with credit memo request and credit memo.

Delivering company handles intercompany customer returns from selling company as follows

  1. Create a returns order to handle the intercompany customer returns from the selling company.
  2. Returns delivery is created post goods receipt when you receive the returned product from the selling company.
  3. Perform product inspection and decide the final logistical follow-up activity.
  4. Determine the refund for the internal customer ‚Äì selling company with credit memo request and credit memo.

There are some special restrictions or takeaway to consider for this option

  • Returns order creation in selling company
    • Intercompany plant can‚Äôt be used if it is copied from sales order. Use the plant belonging to the selling company for the physical receiving of the returned product.
  • Material Inspection in selling company
    • Use logistical follow up activity 0005 ‚Äúship to supplier‚Äù to forward the returned product to the delivery company. Use the BP of the delivery company code as the supplier. BP of the delivering plant is currently not supported.  RPO might encounter the account assignment category issue as it is created with reference to the PO from the sales process. Today, expert configuration can be considered for RPO creation without reference.
  • Supplier Credit Memo in selling company
    • Manual creation is required. With B2B/EDI between the selling company and delivering company, automation is possible.
  • Intercompany returns order in delivering company
    • It can only be created without reference.
    • Use BP of selling company as the sold -to party.
  • Other processes in delivering company are performed as usual, such as product by default not being evaluated during goods receipt.

 

Master Data Set Up for Option 2 and 3

For Solution Option 2 and Option 3, there are below tips to highlight

  • Use the BP of delivery company code as the supplier. Do not use the BP of the delivering plant.
  • For supplier master data
    • Ensure the returns supplier is selected. With selection, you must assign a customer (same partner with customer role) to deal with the outbound shipping for returns purchase order.

 

  • You might maintain the right return‚Äìto address for the supplier if option 2 is used.  Check the help document Return-to Address Determination for Supplier Returns
  •  Ensure you have the right info record maintained for the returns purchase order.

 

Summary

3 solution options in project for intercompany returns to deal with advanced intercompany sales are recommended.

You can adopt the suitable one in your project, considering the restrictions and takeaways in each solution.

entry.title: Batch Split Valuation in Product Cost Controlling and Margin Analysis
entry.content:
Introduction

This blog will illustrate how Cloud ERP standard features and scope items can handle customer‚Äôs product profitability reporting requirements based on product batches. Product cost controlling aspect of split valuation will be our focus and specifically, below scope items are relevant for the blog:

  • Event-Based Production Cost Posting(3F0)
  • Actual costing (33Q)
  • Margin Analysis (J55)

Business requirements

The customer would like to view profitability based on a specific product batch. The revenue for the product is the same cross batches, but the costs may vary for different batches. From management accounting point of view, the ‚Äúcost objects‚Äù here is the combination of products and their batches.

 

Meeting the requirements

SAP Cloud ERP standard features can handle such business requirements. Split valuation based on batches needs to be activated( please refer to blog Split Valuation in Inventory Management on SAP S/4... - SAP Community and its references for more details about split valuation).

With the support of batch split valuation in production accounting (please refer to Split Valuation - Production Scenarios - Product Cost by Order - Production Accounting) Production variances can be posted to the product batches upon goods receipt from the manufacturing orders.

Let‚Äôs demonstrate the processes  with some testing screenshots.

Here, two production orders are created and upon goods receipts, production variances are settled. 

Variances with different categories (SLA Line-Item types) are posted to EO Profitability Segment with Inventory Valuation Type attribute. (only one production order is shown in the screenshots)

Next, two sales orders are created for the same product with plans on delivering two different batches (Inventory Valuation Types) respectively.

With delivery orders created based on the sales orders, post goods issues are performed based on product batches. Here, in the accounting document, the cost of goods sold is with Inventory Valuation Type filled (only one sales order process is shown in the screenshots)

Afterwards, with billing performed, revenue is posted with the product batch as additional dimension.

In Trial Balance app, the profitability can be seen for the product and inventory valuation types, albeit the costs of goods sold at this stage are based on standard costs and they are the same for both valuation types. (Alternatively, other Fiori apps can also be used such as Sales Orders - Actuals, Market Segments ‚Äì Actuals, Product Profitability with Production Variances if the Inventory Valuation Type field is enabled through Data Source Extensions)

During period end, the actual costing run process  will distribute variances proportionally among inventory, work in process, and consumption with the granularity of valuation types and materials. As can be seen, valuation type is available in Material Price Analysis, therefore the ‚Äúcost object‚Äù here is the combination of material and valuation type(batch) and they have different actual prices.

s

(Thanks to @GraceZou  for doing the testing for this part and please refer to her blog Actual Costing in SAP Cloud ERP - SAP Community for Actual Costing business processes)

The previous posted costs of goods sold for the batches(Inventory Valuation Type) will get revaluated to reflect the actual costs for the batches. Together with posted revenues, the profitabilities for the product batches can be arrived at.

From margin analysis side, Inventory Valuation Type will be available in Product Profitability Review Booklet In the upcoming release.

Summary

This blog omits split valuation master data set-up, production planning, sales and distribution aspect of process and screenshots, rather, it focuses on Inventory Valuation Type on accounting documents for the business processes with regards to production accounting, actual costing settlement and revaluation, and profitability reports.

Feel free to leave comments or post questions and explore other content and blogs in the community.

entry.title: Mid-Market SaaS Companies: Running SaaS with Cloud Agility vs. Duct-Tape Systems ‚Äì Best Practice
entry.content:
Are you a rapidly growing SaaS company looking to streamline your operations and scale efficiently?  

Many believe that SAP is only for large enterprises, focused solely on financials, and prohibitively expensive. Let's dispel those myths! 

Introducing SAP Business Suite for Software Providers‚ÄØSAP Business Suite is designed to support the varied lines of businesses within a SaaS company.  

Whether you are: 

  • A CFO‚ÄØ who needs to manage cash flow, budgets, close the books quickly, and provide real-time business visibility to drive strategic decisions. 
  • A CRO‚ÄØlooking to manage your sales pipeline, offer flexible monetization models, and expand into new markets while scaling growth. 
  • A CHRO‚ÄØaiming to manage talent effectively, secure the right skills, and foster ongoing talent development. 
  • A COO‚ÄØstriving to automate processes, scale efficiently, and integrate siloed departments. 

SAP Business Suite addresses these and more with its innovative business platform. 

Hear from Software Providers Leveraging SAP Cloud ERP: 

  • Leadsquared‚ÄØhas automated subscription services with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition. 
  • Seralla harmonized data to support robust lead-to-cash and hire-to-retire processes after a swift migration to the Public Cloud. 

Exciting News: New Industry Best Practice for Subscription Management for Software 

We are thrilled to announce the launch of our Industry Best Practice for Subscription Management for Software. We understand the unique challenges you face: 

  • Data Complexity:‚ÄØDigital offerings require flexible setup, unlike physical products. 
  • Sales System Limitations:‚ÄØEvolving go-to-market strategies demand agile packaging and pricing solutions. 
  • Manual Subscription Processes between sales and provisioning:‚ÄØDecoupled processes lead to errors, customer dissatisfaction, and compliance risks. 
  • Revenue Recognition:‚ÄØNon-integrated processes and manual tasks pose compliance threats. 
  • Subscription Changes:‚ÄØManaging changes during the subscription lifecycle can be cumbersome. 

SAP Business Suite for Software Providers addresses these issues with integrated capabilities, allowing you to streamline your operations and accelerate growth.  

The latest SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition 2508 includes a predefined SAP Best Practice to speed up your adoption. 

And if you are a service or product-centric company that also sells digital assets ‚Äì you can utilize this SAP Best Practice as well. 

Interested in Learning More? 

  • For Prospects:‚ÄØEnabling sustainable growth for Software Providers 
  • For Existing SAP Customers:‚ÄØ Scope item details on SAP for Me ‚Äì SAP Signavio Process Explorer 
  • For Partners and SAP Experts: 
  • Webinar 1:‚ÄØScope Item 5SW: Subscription Management for Software ‚Äì Part 1 
  • Webinar 2:‚ÄØScope Item 5SW: Subscription Management for Software ‚Äì Part 2 
  • For Scaleups ‚Äì high-growth companies experiencing rapid expansion, growing 20% or more in employee headcount and turnover over the last three years. - Grow with SAP for Scaleups 

 

Take the Next Step Towards Agility and Growth 

SAP Business Suite for Software Providers empowers you to optimize your operations, adapt quickly to market changes, and deliver exceptional customer experiences. Join the C-suite leaders who are embracing SAP's cutting-edge solutions to drive their businesses forward. 

Let's connect and discuss how SAP can transform your SaaS journey!

    ‚óã  ËΩ¨ÁßªÊó•ÊúüÔºö03.15.XXXXÔºàÈô§‰∫ÜË¥¢Âπ¥ÊúÄÂêé‰∏ÄÂ§©ÁöÑ‰ªª‰Ωï‰∏ÄÂ§©Ôºâ
    ‚óã ËΩ¨ÁßªÁä∂ÊÄÅÔºöËøõË°å‰∏≠ÔºàÂÖÅËÆ∏ÂÖ∂‰ªñËøáË¥¶Ôºâ Âá≠ËØÅÁ±ªÂûãÔºöËµÑ‰∫ßËøáË¥¶ÔºàAAÔºâÔºàÊ†πÊçÆÁî®Êà∑ÁöÑ‰∏öÂä°ÈúÄÊ±ÇÈÄâÊã©Ôºâ
    ‚óã Â¶ÇÊûúÈúÄË¶ÅÔºåÂêØÁî®ÊåáÁ§∫Âô®‰ª•ÊäëÂà∂ÊäòÊóßËÆ°ÁÆó„ÄÇ
    ‚óã Â¶ÇÊúâÂøÖË¶ÅÔºåËæìÂÖ•Ê≥®Èáä„ÄÇ
